extendedIngredients.name: cod fish fillet
extendedIngredients.original: 1 lb fish fillet, skinned and minced finely (Cod, sole, whitefish)

extendedIngredients.name: Potato Starch Flour
extendedIngredients.original: 5 Tbsps plain flour or potato flour

title: Danish Fish Balls
summary: Danish Fish Balls requires around 50 minutes from start to finish. This gluten free, primal, and pescatarian recipe serves 50 and costs 21 cents per serving. One serving contains 52 calories, 2g of protein, and 4g of fat. 1 person has tried and liked this recipe. If you have butter, fish fillet, salt, and a few other ingredients on hand, you can make it. It is brought to you by Recipezaar. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 8%. This score is very bad (but still fixable). Try Danish Fish Balls, Danish Pancake Balls, and Danish Pancake Balls (Aebleskiver) for similar recipes.

winePairing.pairingText: Fish on the menu? Try pairing with Pinot Grigio, Gruener Veltliner, and Pinot Noir. Fish is as diverse as wine, so it's hard to pick wines that go with every fish. A crisp white wine, such as a pinot grigio or Gr√ºner Veltliner, will suit any delicately flavored white fish. Meaty, strongly flavored fish such as salmon and tuna can even handle a light red wine, such as a pinot noir. One wine you could try is Alsace Willm Pinot Gris Reserve. It has 4.4 out of 5 stars and a bottle costs about 16 dollars.

productMatches.title: Alsace Willm Pinot Gris Reserve
productMatches.description: An intense golden color with hints of ocher, the wine has a nose of ripe fruit, quince. In the mouth the attack is both supple and full, with notes of honey and spices. The final perfectly balances sugar and acidity.Pair this wine alongside pan-fried foie gras, grilled or roasted white meats (pork, veal), rabbit, poultry in cream sauce, smoked fish, mushroom dishes such as risotto.

instructions: Mix seasoning with the minced fish and the flour.Beat the mixture very well and integrate the butter.Add eggs one at a time.Gradually add the liquid.If the mixture curdles stand the bowl in hot water and whisk until it is smooth again.Check your seasoning.Shape the farce into round balls using 2 spoons dipped in hot water.Bring about 2 pints of salted water to a boil.Cook one ball to check the consistency.Add more egg if the ball is too soft, or cream if it is too stiff.If the ball is right cook all the balls, they only take a minute to cook and float when done.Serve as an appetizer, use in the Danish mock turtle soup or make it in a ring shaped mold and serve it with a sauce as your main course.

steps.step: Mix seasoning with the minced fish and the flour.Beat the mixture very well and integrate the butter.

Add eggs one at a time.Gradually add the liquid.If the mixture curdles stand the bowl in hot water and whisk until it is smooth again.Check your seasoning.Shape the farce into round balls using 2 spoons dipped in hot water.Bring about 2 pints of salted water to a boil.Cook one ball to check the consistency.
Add more egg if the ball is too soft, or cream if it is too stiff.If the ball is right cook all the balls, they only take a minute to cook and float when done.
Serve as an appetizer, use in the Danish mock turtle soup or make it in a ring shaped mold and serve it with a sauce as your main course.
